Same prizes as last week! The more you win during the week, the more chances you have to win the big prize drawn on Sunday. Ready?! LFG...>>>

**_Day  12: Start a “worry” journal._**

Anxiety is undoubtedly a destroyer of good sleep. It keeps your mind racing and doesn’t allow you to rest, physically or mentally.

📖 If you find yourself frequently dealing with anxiety or stress in the evening, consider writing in a worry journal. A worry journal allows you to dump all your anxious feelings onto the pages. 

🤔 It helps you express your feelings, and sometimes even discover solutions. The goal is to reduce your anxieties and hush those racing thoughts.

🗒️ This works for those random to-do lists you have floating around or even things you’re excited about. Flesh out, in your journal, what you’re feeling and why. Your brain will get a sense of completion for the fact that you’ve just written this down and it’ll give you an incredible amount of peace.

👋 After getting those anxieties off your chest, leave those worries in the journal. Those worries shouldn’t cross the threshold into your sleep sanctuary. 

Whatever is worrying you can wait until tomorrow. For now, you can’t handle it very efficiently without a well-rested brain.

_Journaling reflection:_
1️⃣ What thoughts keep you up at night?

_Task:_
2️⃣ Write out your lights out time and your evening routine.

_For Fun:_
😃 Post a gif that represents your brain at night in <#972604513255039047>.

{🤫 Secret code... PHOENIXFAM}

**This week's focus is on shifting your mindset.**

Click the "today's tip" button below for some good info, or...

TL;DR Cravings are inevitable but giving in doesn’t mean that you’ve failed.

_Quote of the Day:_
“Our bodies are our gardens – our wills are our gardeners.”  
\- William Shakespeare

<<<Today's Tip:::
💡 **Today's Tip **💡** **

_Make your cravings work FOR you._

When it comes to cravings we usually start out by hating ourselves for being tempted, doing all that we can to resist the craving, ultimately giving up and then feeling extremely guilty about it. Feeling guilty about it causes us to feel like failures which tends to lead to failing again rather than push us in the direction we want to move. 
One way to avoid feeling guilty about giving into temptation (which we all do) is to condition it on the success of a mini-goal. For example, promise yourself that you’ll only eat that donut or cookie you’re craving if you follow through on your lunch plan. That way, you avoid feeling bad about it and it doesn't snowball into repeated ‘failure.’>>>

**This week's focus is on shifting your mindset.**

Click the "today's tip" button below for some good info, or...

TL;DR Treat days you mess up as experiments and use this info as a secret weapon going forward.

_Quote of the Day:_
“Your diet is a bank account. Good food choices are good investments.”
-Bethenny Frankel

<<<Today's Tip:::
💡 **Today's Tip** 💡 

_Challenge: Write down what factors have recently impeded you from successfully sticking to your eating goals._

Envision the most recent time you completely “failed” and gave into major cravings, or had some other negative experience with it.
 
Now breathe… everybody, and we mean everybody struggles with consistency. The truth is that imperfect days teach us the most about how to succeed.
 
Treat days you mess up as experiments. By consciously writing down what factors caused us to struggle, we can better prepare against them. 

On days you aren’t “perfect,” try to answer these questions:
 
🤔 What was my thought process during the first decision I made that led me astray from my goal? What can I learn from this and apply moving forward?

🧐In addition to the above, what are some additional “rules” I can set to prevent what caused this specific slip-up in the future?

😬 What justification did I tell myself to make it okay to slip up?
 
These mental insights can really act as secret weapons on days we struggle. We will all miss our habits. Let’s make those days just as valuable as perfect days by treating them as learning experiences.>>>

<@&866741150740381727> We're rounding out the first week of Nutrition! Standing ovation for all of you. Excited to chat with you at [Phoenix Friday](https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1zqKVPZnVdWJB) soon!

**This week's focus is on shifting your mindset.**

Click the "today's tip" button below for some good info, or...

TL;DR When you’re getting down on yourself, sit and reflect, identify, forgive, and move on with even more understanding and love for yourself.

_Quote of the Day:_
“Do what you have to do until you can do what you want to do.” 
-Oprah Winfrey

<<<Today's Tip:::
💡 **Today's Tip** 💡 

_Challenge: Think about what the image of perfection you’ve created for yourself is… Now realize that you may NEVER fit that image! _

Instead, be yourself and love yourself for all that you are.

Most of us subconsciously judge ourselves for not fitting this image of perfection whenever we slip up or struggle, even the slightest bit. This is a horrendous activity that will lead you to unhappiness, a spiral of guilt, a feeling of unworthiness, and freeze you in inactivity.

What does this cycle do to help you succeed and live a happy life? NOTHING. The truth is, the quicker you can do the following, the happier your life will be day after day.

Whenever you feel you’re not in a state of pure happiness:

🤔 Determine what mistakes you made and what went wrong.
🗒️ Identify what you can learn from these mistakes and apply it to your future.
🧘 Forgive yourself. Now forgive yourself again.
🥰 Love yourself for exactly who you are right now.
🏃‍♀️Now move forward full speed ahead with what you’ve learned.

It doesn’t matter if it takes you 50 learning cycles or 5 years of mistakes - the second you lose is when you throw on that useless guilt and those unnecessary negative emotions because you're trashing your quality of life… and increasing your quality of life is the whole point you're doing this in the first place!>>>

<@&1027308048236163232> Can you believe we're about to finish out THREE weeks?! I hope this challenge has been as helpful as it has been fun. Let's keep it going!

**The focus this week is on Quality Sleep.**

We're working on new ways to deliver this content to you. You'll now click the buttons below to answer the prompt associated with it and it will auto-populate into <#972604513255039047>. 😃 We'll be adding more fun stuff, too! 

Same prizes as last week! The more you win during the week, the more chances you have to win the big prize drawn on Sunday. Ready?! LFG...

**_Day 11: Combatting racing thoughts._**

Worries, racing thoughts, and anxiety can get you stuck in a big pile of negativity quicksand. It becomes hard to remove yourself from it and keeps you in a state of panic.

Next time you find yourself struggling with racing thoughts, try this visualization technique to quiet your mind:

- **Close your eyes** and let yourself visualize whatever comes to mind - not just words, but an actual image. Pay attention to all the details, explore it, allow yourself to wonder how it will change.
- **Let your mind focus** on it completely. Allow the visualization to become more clear, more detailed, and more sharp. Sink deeper into the trance created by this visualization.
- **Generate random items** from your racing thoughts and refocus them into something that helps you relax. For instance, visualize shooting those items into the air as if they shot from a cannon.
- **Continue this visualization technique** and fall deeper and deeper into the trance. Eventually, you should become relaxed enough to fall asleep.

_Reflecting on racing thoughts:_
1️⃣ How often does your mind keep you up at night and how do you handle it? 
_Task:_
2️⃣ Write out your lights out time and your evening routine.
_For Fun:_
😃 Post a gif that represents your brain at night in <#972604513255039047>

<@&1027308048236163232> We've just crushed TWO WEEKS of sleep together, ya'll! 😮 Looking forward to hearing how you've done this week at today's Phoenix Friday! 

\*\*The focus this week is on Creating a Valuable Sleep Routine.\*\*

Just joining us? Each week day, I post a new prompt centered around sleep. Submit responses in <#1025421246038552646> to be entered. You can choose to answer one or all of the prompts; you are entered into the raffle for each prompt you complete. Daily winners are entered in to a weekly drawing, chosen on Sunday. 

Weekly winner will get their choice of: 
🍽 Nice dinner for two. 
📚 Three free journals from our Web2 company (<https://habitnest.com/>) 
🛍 A $75 Amazon gift card 
🪶 A Phoenix NFT 


\*\*Day Ten: Improve your mornings\*\*

\*Use your evening routine to prep for a successful morning.\* 

There’s no better favor you can do for your future self than to prep in advance so that the day can flow more smoothly and with a lighter workload! Setting yourself up for success can be a powerful part of your evening routine, and it can help you go to sleep with less mental clutter. 

Set aside time in your evening routine (ideally at least 15-30 minutes) to do something that helps you prepare for tomorrow. 

\*Here are some prep ideas:\* 

🗒 Knock a couple of small to-do’s off your task list for tomorrow 
🧹 Tidy up around the house 
👟 Set out your outfit and shoes for tomorrow 
🥚 Prep your lunch and/or breakfast 
🔑 Gather up your wallet, keys, purse/bag, etc., to avoid spending time looking for them in the morning 

For other ideas that are more specific to your situation, ask yourself what usually holds you up or makes you feel stressed in the morning, and then ask yourself how you can prep tonight in order to make your morning go more smoothly. 

\*Morning Prep Reflection:\* 
1️⃣ How often do you find yourself scrambling in the morning? What can you take care of in the evening to make your morning go more smoothly? 

\*Task:\* 
2️⃣ Write out your routine for tonight and add one item that will help start your morning off well. 
3️⃣ How was last night’s routine? Did you do anything to invest in yourself?

Welcome to Nutrition Week ONE!
For the next 3 weeks we will focus on mindful eating... not dieting. 
**This week's focus is on shifting your mindset.**

Click the "today's tip" button below for some good info, or...

TL;DR This challenge will help you become more aware of your food choices. The simpler the food, the easier it will be to understand the effect on your body.

**Quote of the Day:**
“The easier it is to do, the harder it is to change.” 
\- Eng’s Principle

<<<Today's Tip:::
**_Keep it simple._**

The more simple your food is (i.e. the less ingredients in your food), the more you know about it. The more you know about what your food consists of, the easier it is to gain knowledge about how different types of food affect your body. 

As we head into this three-week challenge, start thinking of yourself as a scientist and do your best to see how different foods affect your energy levels, which foods make you feel more or less satiated, and even whether they affect your mood.

This challenge is about becoming more aware and mindful of your food choices. We are not sending you on a weird diet. Simple, straightforward, real is the name of this game.>>>

Daily winners are entered in to a weekly drawing, chosen on Sunday.

_Weekly winner will get their choice of:_
🍽️ Nice dinner for two.
📚 Three free journals from our Web2 company (https://habitnest.com/)
🛍️ A $75 Amazon gift card
🪶 A Phoenix NFT>>>

<@&1028380256731660359> How was that water chugging yesterday? Ready to up your game? 👀

**This week's focus is on shifting your nutrition mindset.**

Click the "today's tip" button below for some good info, or...

TL;DR Cheat days are tough to come back from, indulgent meals are more sustainable in the long-term.

_Quote of the Day:_
“Health is a relationship between you and your body” 
-Terri Guillemet

<<<Today's Tip:::
💡 **Today's Tip** 💡 

_Eat an indulgent meal every few days instead of having full cheat days._
Most people have “cheat days” during which they eat whatever they want for a full day or weekend. 

There are two problems with this:

1️⃣ It makes it WAY harder to go back to eating healthy the next day. 

2️⃣ A full day of garbage makes you feel like garbage for multiple days, and actually forces your body to crave the garbage that made it feel horrible in the first place.

If you can commit to just ONE completely unmonitored, indulgent meal of your choice, one meal at a time every couple of days, you won’t feel horrible for days on end, and it’ll be easy to continue with your healthy eating regimen immediately after.

Another approach you can try is having two days a week where you maintain your weight instead of staying in a caloric deficit/surplus.>>>
